titlestmt.titleproper: Alfred Gemmell biography of William Darrah Kelley undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

did.unittitle: Alfred Gemmell biography of William Darrah Kelley
did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Alfred Gemmell received his master's degree in history from the University of Pennsylvania in 1947. William Darrah Kelley (1814-1890) was a judge and politician from Philadelphia. He served as a judge of the Court of Common Pleas for Philadelphia from 1846-1856. Kelley was elected as a Republican to Congress in 1860 and served from March 4, 1861, until his death.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a typed manuscript of Gemmell's biography of William Darrah Kelley, which includes a bibliography of sources on Kelley. Chapter three is missing and notes are present for only two chapters.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
